subject: Re: [junit] need help
msgSnippet: ... Or indeed assertEquals( obj1.getClass(), obj2.getCLass() ); which is where I came in many posts ago ... -- Chris electric hedgehog Dollin
messageBody:
On Monday 04 April 2005 11:09, Andrew McDonagh wrote:
> A.J. Bonnema wrote:
> >Andrew McDonagh wrote:
> >>Chris Dollin wrote:
> >>>On Monday 21 March 2005 10:46, sadia zai wrote:
> >>>>i want to test the types of two objects are same or not ,,
> >>>>how can i do dis
> >>
> >>you can also use...
> >>
> >>
> >>assertTrue(o1.getClass().isInstance(o2.getClass());
> >
> >Watch it though: you will also aprove subclasses in this manner. If it
> >is only about assignability, fine. But if you need the *same* class,
> >isInstanceOf will not work as expected.
> >
> >Guus.
>
> Correct, if the OP wants to know whether Object Obj1 and Object Obj2 are
> the same type, then a simple
>
> obj1.getClass() == obj2.getCLass() would surfice.

Or indeed

assertEquals( obj1.getClass(), obj2.getCLass() );

which is where I came in many posts ago ...

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
